Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה תְּצַוֶּ֣ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ שֶׁ֣מֶן זַ֥יִת זָ֛ךְ כָּתִ֖ית לַמָּא֑וֹר לְהַעֲלֹ֥ת נֵ֖ר תָּמִֽיד׃
Translit: vəʾattåh tətṣavveh ʾeth-bənē yisråʾēl vəyiqḥū ʾēlekhå shemen zayith zåkh kåthîth lammåʾōr ləhaʿalōth nēr tåmîdh
English: And thou shalt command the children of Israel, that they bring thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamp to burn always.

Hebrew: בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֩ מִח֨וּץ לַפָּרֹ֜כֶת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָעֵדֻ֗ת יַעֲרֹךְ֩ אֹת֨וֹ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו מֵעֶ֥רֶב עַד־בֹּ֖קֶר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹ֣רֹתָ֔ם מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: bəʾōhel mōʿēdh miḥūtṣ lappårōkheth ʾasher ʿal-håʿēdhuth yaʿarōkh ʾōthō ʾaharōn ūvånåv mēʿerev ʿadh-bōqer lifnē ʾadhōnåi ḥuqqath ʿōlåm lədhōrōthåm mēʾēth bənē yisråʾēl
English: In the tabernacle of the congregation without the vail, which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the LORD: it shall be a statute for ever unto their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֡ה הַקְרֵ֣ב אֵלֶיךָ֩ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֨ן אָחִ֜יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו אִתּ֔וֹ מִתּ֛וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִ֑י אַהֲרֹ֕ן נָדָ֧ב וַאֲבִיה֛וּא אֶלְעָזָ֥ר וְאִיתָמָ֖ר בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translit: vəʾattåh haqrēv ʾēlekhå ʾeth-ʾaharōn ʾåḥîkhå vəʾeth-bånåv ʾittō mittōkh bənē yisråʾēl ləkhahanō-lî ʾaharōn nådhåv vaʾavîhūʾ ʾelʿåzår vəʾîthåmår bənē ʾaharōn
English: And take thou unto thee Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's sons.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֖דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֑יךָ לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå vighdhē-qōdhesh ləʾaharōn ʾåḥîkhå ləkhåvōdh ūləthifʾåreth
English: And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother for glory and for beauty.

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה תְּדַבֵּר֙ אֶל־כָּל־חַכְמֵי־לֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִלֵּאתִ֖יו ר֣וּחַ חָכְמָ֑ה וְעָשׂ֞וּ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֧י אַהֲרֹ֛ן לְקַדְּשׁ֖וֹ לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
Translit: vəʾattåh tədhabbēr ʾel-kål-ḥakhmē-lēv ʾasher millēʾthîv rūaḥ ḥåkhmåh vəʿåsū ʾeth-bighdhē ʾaharōn ləqaddəshō ləkhahanō-lî
English: And thou shalt speak unto all that are wise hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron's garments to consecrate him, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה הַבְּגָדִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשׂ֗וּ חֹ֤שֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד֙ וּמְעִ֔יל וּכְתֹ֥נֶת תַּשְׁבֵּ֖ץ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת וְאַבְנֵ֑ט וְעָשׂ֨וּ בִגְדֵי־קֹ֜דֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִ֛יךָ וּלְבָנָ֖יו לְכַהֲנוֹ־לִֽי׃
Translit: vəʾēlleh habbəghådhîm ʾasher yaʿasū ḥōshen vəʾēfōdh ūməʿîl ūkhəthōneth tashbētṣ mitṣnefeth vəʾavnēṭ vəʿåsū vighdhē-qōdhesh ləʾaharōn ʾåḥîkhå ūləvånåv ləkhahanō-lî
English: And these are the garments which they shall make; a breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a broidered coat, a mitre, and a girdle: and they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and his sons, that he may minister unto me in the priest's office.

Hebrew: וְהֵם֙ יִקְח֣וּ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֶת־הַתְּכֵ֖לֶת וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְגָּמָ֑ן וְאֶת־תּוֹלַ֥עַת הַשָּׁנִ֖י וְאֶת־הַשֵּֽׁשׁ׃
Translit: vəhēm yiqḥū ʾeth-hazzåhåv vəʾeth-hattəkhēleth vəʾeth-håʾargåmån vəʾeth-tōlaʿath hasshånî vəʾeth-hasshēsh
English: And they shall take gold, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen.

Hebrew: וְעָשׂ֖וּ אֶת־הָאֵפֹ֑ד זָ֠הָב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן תּוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָ֖ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translit: vəʿåsū ʾeth-håʾēfōdh zåhåv təkhēleth vəʾargåmån tōlaʿath shånî vəshēsh måshzår maʿasēh ḥōshēv
English: And they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and of purple, of scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cunning work.
column7: that I may dwell among them.

Hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֧י כְתֵפֹ֣ת חֹֽבְרֹ֗ת יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֛וֹ אֶל־שְׁנֵ֥י קְצוֹתָ֖יו וְחֻבָּֽר׃
Translit: shətē khəthēfōth ḥōvərōth yihyeh-lō ʾel-shənē qətṣōthåv vəḥubbår
English: It shall have the two shoulderpieces thereof joined at the two edges thereof; and so it shall be joined together.

Hebrew: וְחֵ֤שֶׁב אֲפֻדָּתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֔יו כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֖הוּ מִמֶּ֣נּוּ יִהְיֶ֑ה זָהָ֗ב תְּכֵ֧לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֛ן וְתוֹלַ֥עַת שָׁנִ֖י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָֽר׃
Translit: vəḥēshev ʾafuddåthō ʾasher ʿålåv kəmaʿasēhū mimmennū yihyeh zåhåv təkhēleth vəʾargåmån vəthōlaʿath shånî vəshēsh måshzår
English: And the curious girdle of the ephod, which is upon it, shall be of the same, according to the work thereof; even of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

Hebrew: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֖י אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֑הַם וּפִתַּחְתָּ֣ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁמ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå ʾeth-shətē ʾavnē-shōham ūfittaḥtå ʿalēhem shəmōth bənē yisråʾēl
English: And thou shalt take two onyx stones, and grave on them the names of the children of Israel:

Hebrew: שִׁשָּׁה֙ מִשְּׁמֹתָ֔ם עַ֖ל הָאֶ֣בֶן הָאֶחָ֑ת וְאֶת־שְׁמ֞וֹת הַשִּׁשָּׁ֧ה הַנּוֹתָרִ֛ים עַל־הָאֶ֥בֶן הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית כְּתוֹלְדֹתָֽם׃
Translit: shisshåh misshəmōthåm ʿal håʾeven håʾeḥåth vəʾeth-shəmōth hasshisshåh hannōthårîm ʿal-håʾeven hasshēnîth kəthōlədhōthåm
English: Six of their names on one stone, and the other six names of the rest on the other stone, according to their birth.

Hebrew: מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חָרַשׁ֮ אֶבֶן֒ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֗ם תְּפַתַּח֙ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֔ים עַל־שְׁמֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מֻסַבֹּ֛ת מִשְׁבְּצ֥וֹת זָהָ֖ב תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translit: maʿasēh ḥårash ʾeven pittūḥē ḥōthåm təfattaḥ ʾeth-shətē håʾavånîm ʿal-shəmōth bənē yisråʾēl musabbōth mishbətṣōth zåhåv taʿaseh ʾōthåm
English: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, shalt thou engrave the two stones with the names of the children of Israel: thou shalt make them to be set in ouches of gold.

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֞ אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י הָאֲבָנִ֗ים עַ֚ל כִּתְפֹ֣ת הָֽאֵפֹ֔ד אַבְנֵ֥י זִכָּרֹ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנָשָׂא֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־שְׁמוֹתָ֜ם לִפְנֵ֧י יְהוָ֛ה עַל־שְׁתֵּ֥י כְתֵפָ֖יו לְזִכָּרֹֽן׃
Translit: vəsamtå ʾeth-shətē håʾavånîm ʿal kithfōth håʾēfōdh ʾavnē zikkårōn livnē yisråʾēl vənåsåʾ ʾaharōn ʾeth-shəmōthåm lifnē ʾadhōnåi ʿal-shətē khəthēfåv ləzikkårōn
English: And thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulders of the ephod for stones of memorial unto the children of Israel: and Aaron shall bear their names before the LORD upon his two shoulders for a memorial.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִשְׁבְּצֹ֖ת זָהָֽב׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå mishbətṣōth zåhåv
English: And thou shalt make ouches of gold;

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֤י שַׁרְשְׁרֹת֙ זָהָ֣ב טָה֔וֹר מִגְבָּלֹ֛ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה אֶת־שַׁרְשְׁרֹ֥ת הָעֲבֹתֹ֖ת עַל־הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצֹֽת׃
Translit: ūshətē sharshərōth zåhåv ṭåhōr mighbålōth taʿaseh ʾōthåm maʿasēh ʿavōth vənåthattåh ʾeth-sharshərōth håʿavōthōth ʿal-hammishbətṣōth
English: And two chains of pure gold at the ends; of wreathen work shalt thou make them, and fasten the wreathen chains to the ouches.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חֹ֤שֶׁן מִשְׁפָּט֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה חֹשֵׁ֔ב כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה אֵפֹ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֑נּוּ זָ֠הָב תְּכֵ֨לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֜ן וְתוֹלַ֧עַת שָׁנִ֛י וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מָשְׁזָ֖ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå ḥōshen mishpåṭ maʿasēh ḥōshēv kəmaʿasēh ʾēfōdh taʿasennū zåhåv təkhēleth vəʾargåmån vəthōlaʿath shånî vəshēsh måshzår taʿaseh ʾōthō
English: And thou shalt make the breastplate of judgment with cunning work; after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it; of gold, of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine twined linen, shalt thou make it.

Hebrew: רָב֥וּעַ יִֽהְיֶ֖ה כָּפ֑וּל זֶ֥רֶת אָרְכּ֖וֹ וְזֶ֥רֶת רָחְבּֽוֹ׃
Translit: råvūaʿ yihyeh kåfūl zereth ʾårkō vəzereth råḥbō
English: Foursquare it shall be being doubled; a span shall be the length thereof, and a span shall be the breadth thereof.

Hebrew: וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ בוֹ֙ מִלֻּ֣אַת אֶ֔בֶן אַרְבָּעָ֖ה טוּרִ֣ים אָ֑בֶן ט֗וּר אֹ֤דֶם פִּטְדָה֙ וּבָרֶ֔קֶת הַטּ֖וּר הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translit: ūmillēʾthå vō milluʾath ʾeven ʾarbåʿåh ṭūrîm ʾåven ṭūr ʾōdhem piṭdhåh ūvåreqeth haṭṭūr håʾeḥådh
English: And thou shalt set in it settings of stones, even four rows of stones: the first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this shall be the first row.

Hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשֵּׁנִ֑י נֹ֥פֶךְ סַפִּ֖יר וְיָהֲלֹֽם׃
Translit: vəhaṭṭūr hasshēnî nōfekh sappîr vəyåhalōm
English: And the second row shall be an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.

Hebrew: וְהַטּ֖וּר הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י לֶ֥שֶׁם שְׁב֖וֹ וְאַחְלָֽמָה׃
Translit: vəhaṭṭūr hasshəlîshî leshem shəvō vəʾaḥlåmåh
English: And the third row a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
column7: and in the ark thou shalt put the testimony that I shall give thee.

Hebrew: וְהַטּוּר֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔י תַּרְשִׁ֥ישׁ וְשֹׁ֖הַם וְיָשְׁפֵ֑ה מְשֻׁבָּצִ֥ים זָהָ֛ב יִהְי֖וּ בְּמִלּוּאֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vəhaṭṭūr hårvîʿî tarshîsh vəshōham vəyåshfēh məshubbåtṣîm zåhåv yihyū bəmillūʾōthåm
English: And the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.

Hebrew: וְ֠הָאֲבָנִים תִּֽהְיֶ֜יןָ עַל־שְׁמֹ֧ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה עַל־שְׁמֹתָ֑ם פִּתּוּחֵ֤י חוֹתָם֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־שְׁמ֔וֹ תִּֽהְיֶ֕יןָ לִשְׁנֵ֥י עָשָׂ֖ר שָֽׁבֶט׃
Translit: vəhåʾavånîm tihyenå ʿal-shəmōth bənē-yisråʾēl shətēm ʿesrēh ʿal-shəmōthåm pittūḥē ḥōthåm ʾîsh ʿal-shəmō tihyenå lishnē ʿåsår shåveṭ
English: And the stones shall be with the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet; every one with his name shall they be according to the twelve tribes.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֧יתָ עַל־הַחֹ֛שֶׁן שַֽׁרְשֹׁ֥ת גַּבְלֻ֖ת מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה עֲבֹ֑ת זָהָ֖ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå ʿal-haḥōshen sharshōth gavluth maʿasēh ʿavōth zåhåv ṭåhōr
English: And thou shalt make upon the breastplate chains at the ends of wreathen work of pure gold.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ֙ עַל־הַחֹ֔שֶׁן שְׁתֵּ֖י טַבְּע֣וֹת זָהָ֑ב וְנָתַתָּ֗ אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ הַטַּבָּע֔וֹת עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י קְצ֥וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå ʿal-haḥōshen shətē ṭabbəʿōth zåhåv vənåthattå ʾeth-shətē haṭṭabbåʿōth ʿal-shənē qətṣōth haḥōshen
English: And thou shalt make upon the breastplate two rings of gold, and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֗ה אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ עֲבֹתֹ֣ת הַזָּהָ֔ב עַל־שְׁתֵּ֖י הַטַּבָּעֹ֑ת אֶל־קְצ֖וֹת הַחֹֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: vənåthattåh ʾeth-shətē ʿavōthōth hazzåhåv ʿal-shətē haṭṭabbåʿōth ʾel-qətṣōth haḥōshen
English: And thou shalt put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings which are on the ends of the breastplate.

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת שְׁתֵּ֤י קְצוֹת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָעֲבֹתֹ֔ת תִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֑וֹת וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־כִּתְפ֥וֹת הָאֵפֹ֖ד אֶל־מ֥וּל פָּנָֽיו׃

English: And they shall bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate be not loosed from the ephod.

Translit: vənåsåʾ ʾaharōn ʾeth-shəmōth bənē-yisråʾēl bəḥōshen hammishpåṭ ʿal-libbō bəvōʾō ʾel-haqqōdhesh ləzikkårōn lifnē-ʾadhōnåi tåmîdh
English: And Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart, when he goeth in unto the holy place, for a memorial before the LORD continually.

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֞ אֶל־חֹ֣שֶׁן הַמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט אֶת־הָאוּרִים֙ וְאֶת־הַתֻּמִּ֔ים וְהָיוּ֙ עַל־לֵ֣ב אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּבֹא֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְנָשָׂ֣א אַ֠הֲרֹן אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֨ט בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל עַל־לִבּ֛וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃

English: And thou shalt put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be upon Aaron's heart, when he goeth in before the LORD: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before the LORD continually.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ אֶת־מְעִ֥יל הָאֵפ֖וֹד כְּלִ֥יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå ʾeth-məʿîl håʾēfōdh kəlîl təkhēleth
English: And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue.

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה פִֽי־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ בְּתוֹכ֑וֹ שָׂפָ֡ה יִֽהְיֶה֩ לְפִ֨יו סָבִ֜יב מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹרֵ֗ג כְּפִ֥י תַחְרָ֛א יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִקָּרֵֽעַ׃
Translit: vəhåyåh fî-rōʾshō bəthōkhō såfåh yihyeh ləfîv såvîv maʿasēh ʾōrēgh kəfî thaḥråʾ yihyeh-lō lōʾ yiqqårēaʿ
English: And there shall be an hole in the top of it, in the midst thereof: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of an habergeon, that it be not rent.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ עַל־שׁוּלָ֗יו רִמֹּנֵי֙ תְּכֵ֤לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן֙ וְתוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י עַל־שׁוּלָ֖יו סָבִ֑יב וּפַעֲמֹנֵ֥י זָהָ֛ב בְּתוֹכָ֖ם סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå ʿal-shūlåv rimmōnē təkhēleth vəʾargåmån vəthōlaʿath shånî ʿal-shūlåv såvîv ūfaʿamōnē zåhåv bəthōkhåm såvîv
English: And beneath upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, round about the hem thereof; and bells of gold between them round about:

Translit: vəhåyåh ʿal-ʾaharōn ləshårēth vənishmaʿ qōlō bəvōʾō ʾel-haqqōdhesh lifnē ʾadhōnåi ūvətṣēʾthō vəlōʾ yåmūth
English: And it shall be upon Aaron to minister: and his sound shall be heard when he goeth in unto the holy place before the LORD, and when he cometh out, that he die not.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ צִּ֖יץ זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וּפִתַּחְתָּ֤ עָלָיו֙ פִּתּוּחֵ֣י חֹתָ֔ם קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå tṣîtṣ zåhåv ṭåhōr ūfittaḥtå ʿålåv pittūḥē ḥōthåm qōdhesh laʾdhōnåi
English: And thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and grave upon it, like the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֤ אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־פְּתִ֣יל תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְהָיָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּצְנָ֑פֶת אֶל־מ֥וּל פְּנֵֽי־הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translit: vəsamtå ʾōthō ʿal-pəthîl təkhēleth vəhåyåh ʿal-hammitṣnåfeth ʾel-mūl pənē-hammitṣnefeth yihyeh
English: And thou shalt put it on a blue lace, that it may be upon the mitre; upon the forefront of the mitre it shall be.

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֮ עַל־מֵ֣צַח אַהֲרֹן֒ וְנָשָׂ֨א אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַקְדִּ֨ישׁוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְכָֽל־מַתְּנֹ֖ת קָדְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם וְהָיָ֤ה עַל־מִצְחוֹ֙ תָּמִ֔יד לְרָצ֥וֹן לָהֶ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəhåyåh ʿal-mētṣaḥ ʾaharōn vənåsåʾ ʾaharōn ʾeth-ʿavōn haqqodhåshîm ʾasher yaqdîshū bənē yisråʾēl ləkhål-mattənōth qådhshēhem vəhåyåh ʿal-mitṣḥō tåmîdh ləråtṣōn låhem lifnē ʾadhōnåi
English: And it shall be upon Aaron's forehead, that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always upon his forehead, that they may be accepted before the LORD.

Hebrew: וְשִׁבַּצְתָּ֙ הַכְּתֹ֣נֶת שֵׁ֔שׁ וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִצְנֶ֣פֶת שֵׁ֑שׁ וְאַבְנֵ֥ט תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה רֹקֵֽם׃

English: And thou shalt embroider the coat of fine linen, and thou shalt make the mitre of fine linen, and thou shalt make the girdle of needlework.

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה כֻתֳּנֹ֔ת וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם אַבְנֵטִ֑ים וּמִגְבָּעוֹת֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם לְכָב֖וֹד וּלְתִפְאָֽרֶת׃

English: And for Aaron's sons thou shalt make coats, and thou shalt make for them girdles, and bonnets shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.

Hebrew: וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ אֶת־אַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֔יךָ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֨ אֹתָ֜ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֧ אֶת־יָדָ֛ם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם וְכִהֲנ֥וּ לִֽי׃

English: And thou shalt put them upon Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him; and shalt anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister unto me in the priest's office.

Translit: vəhåiū ʿal-ʾaharōn vəʿal-bånåv bəvōʾåm ʾel-ʾōhel mōʿēdh ʾō vəghishtåm ʾel-hammizbēaḥ ləshårēth baqqōdhesh vəlōʾ-yisʾū ʿåvōn våmēthū ḥuqqath ʿōlåm lō ūləzarʿō ʾaḥaråv
English: And they shall be upon Aaron, and upon his sons, when they come in unto the tabernacle of the congregation, or when they come near unto the altar to minister in the holy place; that they bear not iniquity, and die: it shall be a statute for ever unto him and his seed after him.

Hebrew: וְזֶ֨ה הַדָּבָ֜ר אֲשֶֽׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם לְקַדֵּ֥שׁ אֹתָ֖ם לְכַהֵ֣ן לִ֑י לְ֠קַח פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֧ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר וְאֵילִ֥ם שְׁנַ֖יִם תְּמִימִֽם׃

English: And this is the thing that thou shalt do unto them to hallow them, to minister unto me in the priest's office: Take one young bullock, and two rams without blemish,

Hebrew: וְלֶ֣חֶם מַצּ֗וֹת וְחַלֹּ֤ת מַצֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן סֹ֥לֶת חִטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָֽם׃

English: And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: of wheaten flour shalt thou make them.

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֤ אוֹתָם֙ עַל־סַ֣ל אֶחָ֔ד וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּסָּ֑ל וְאֶ֨ת־הַפָּ֔ר וְאֵ֖ת שְׁנֵ֥י הָאֵילִֽם׃
Translit: vənåthattå ʾōthåm ʿal-sal ʾeḥådh vəhiqravtå ʾōthåm bassål vəʾeth-happår vəʾēth shənē håʾēlim
English: And thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ תַּקְרִ֔יב אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְרָחַצְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translit: vəʾeth-ʾaharōn vəʾeth-bånåv taqrîv ʾel-pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh vəråḥatṣtå ʾōthåm bammåyim
English: And Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shalt wash them with water.

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הַבְּגָדִ֗ים וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֤ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֔נֶת וְאֵת֙ מְעִ֣יל הָאֵפֹ֔ד וְאֶת־הָאֵפֹ֖ד וְאֶת־הַחֹ֑שֶׁן וְאָפַדְתָּ֣ ל֔וֹ בְּחֵ֖שֶׁב הָאֵפֹֽד׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå ʾeth-habbəghådhîm vəhilbashtå ʾeth-ʾaharōn ʾeth-hakkuttōneth vəʾēth məʿîl håʾēfōdh vəʾeth-håʾēfōdh vəʾeth-haḥōshen vəʾåfadhtå lō bəḥēshev håʾēfōdh
English: And thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron the coat, and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the curious girdle of the ephod:

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ הַמִּצְנֶ֖פֶת עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְנָתַתָּ֛ אֶת־נֵ֥זֶר הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ עַל־הַמִּצְנָֽפֶת׃
Translit: vəsamtå hammitṣnefeth ʿal-rōʾshō vənåthattå ʾeth-nēzer haqqōdhesh ʿal-hammitṣnåfeth
English: And thou shalt put the mitre upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the mitre.

Hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־שֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֔ה וְיָצַקְתָּ֖ עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֖ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå ʾeth-shemen hammishḥåh vəyåtṣaqtå ʿal-rōʾshō ūmåshaḥtå ʾōthō
English: Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour it upon his head, and anoint him.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖יו תַּקְרִ֑יב וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֖ם כֻּתֳּנֹֽת׃
Translit: vəʾeth-bånåv taqrîv vəhilbashtåm kuttonōth
English: And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.

Hebrew: וְחָגַרְתָּ֩ אֹתָ֨ם אַבְנֵ֜ט אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֗יו וְחָבַשְׁתָּ֤ לָהֶם֙ מִגְבָּעֹ֔ת וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם כְּהֻנָּ֖ה לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וּמִלֵּאתָ֥ יַֽד־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְיַד־בָּנָֽיו׃
Translit: vəḥåghartå ʾōthåm ʾavnēṭ ʾaharōn ūvånåv vəḥåvashtå låhem mighbåʿōth vəhåythåh låhem kəhunnåh ləḥuqqath ʿōlåm ūmillēʾthå yadh-ʾaharōn vəyadh-bånåv
English: And thou shalt gird them with girdles, Aaron and his sons, and put the bonnets on them: and the priest's office shall be their's for a perpetual statute: and thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons.

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַפָּ֔ר לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הַפָּֽר׃
Translit: vəhiqravtå ʾeth-happår lifnē ʾōhel mōʿēdh vəsåmakh ʾaharōn ūvånåv ʾeth-yədhēhem ʿal-rōʾsh happår
English: And thou shalt cause a bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַפָּ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translit: vəshåḥaṭtå ʾeth-happår lifnē ʾadhōnåi pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh
English: And thou shalt kill the bullock before the LORD, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְנָתַתָּ֛ה עַל־קַרְנֹ֥ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ בְּאֶצְבָּעֶ֑ךָ וְאֶת־כָּל־הַדָּ֣ם תִּשְׁפֹּ֔ךְ אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå middam happår vənåthattåh ʿal-qarnōth hammizbēaḥ bəʾetṣbåʿekhå vəʾeth-kål-haddåm tishpōkh ʾel-yəsōdh hammizbēaḥ
English: And thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and put it upon the horns of the altar with thy finger, and pour all the blood beside the bottom of the altar.

Hebrew: וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֗ אֶֽת־כָּל־הַחֵלֶב֮ הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּרֶב֒ וְאֵ֗ת הַיֹּתֶ֨רֶת֙ עַל־הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֵת֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֖לֶב אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֑ן וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֖ הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå ʾeth-kål-haḥēlev hamkhasseh ʾeth-haqqerev vəʾēth hayyōthereth ʿal-hakkåvēdh vəʾēth shətē hakkəlåyōth vəʾeth-haḥēlev ʾasher ʿalēhen vəhiqṭartå hammizbēḥåh
English: And thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul that is above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and burn them upon the altar.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּשַׂ֤ר הַפָּר֙ וְאֶת־עֹר֣וֹ וְאֶת־פִּרְשׁ֔וֹ תִּשְׂרֹ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה חַטָּ֖את הֽוּא׃
Translit: vəʾeth-bəsar happår vəʾeth-ʿōrō vəʾeth-pirshō tisrōf båʾēsh miḥūtṣ lammaḥaneh ḥaṭṭåʾth hūʾ
English: But the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung, shalt thou burn with fire without the camp: it is a sin offering.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַ֥יִל הָאֶחָ֖ד תִּקָּ֑ח וְסָ֨מְכ֜וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
Translit: vəʾeth-håʾayil håʾeḥådh tiqqåḥ vəsåmkhū ʾaharōn ūvånåv ʾeth-yədhēhem ʿal-rōʾsh håʾåyil
English: Thou shalt also take one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֖ אֶת־הָאָ֑יִל וְלָֽקַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ וְזָרַקְתָּ֥ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vəshåḥaṭtå ʾeth-håʾåyil vəlåqaḥtå ʾeth-dåmō vəzåraqtå ʿal-hammizbēaḥ såvîv
English: And thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take his blood, and sprinkle it round about upon the altar.

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־הָאַ֔יִל תְּנַתֵּ֖חַ לִנְתָחָ֑יו וְרָחַצְתָּ֤ קִרְבּוֹ֙ וּכְרָעָ֔יו וְנָתַתָּ֥ עַל־נְתָחָ֖יו וְעַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translit: vəʾeth-håʾayil tənattēaḥ linthåḥåv vəråḥatṣtå qirbō ūkhəråʿåv vənåthattå ʿal-nəthåḥåv vəʿal-rōʾshō
English: And thou shalt cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inwards of him, and his legs, and put them unto his pieces, and unto his head.

Hebrew: וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֤ אֶת־כָּל־הָאַ֨יִל֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֥ה ה֖וּא לַֽיהוָ֑ה רֵ֣יחַ נִיח֔וֹחַ אִשֶּׁ֥ה לַיהוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translit: vəhiqṭartå ʾeth-kål-håʾayil hammizbēḥåh ʿōlåh hūʾ laʾdhōnåi rēaḥ nîḥōaḥ ʾissheh laʾdhōnåi hūʾ
English: And thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it is a burnt offering unto the LORD: it is a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְלָ֣קַחְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת הָאַ֣יִל הַשֵּׁנִ֑י וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå ʾēth håʾayil hasshēnî vəsåmakh ʾaharōn ūvånåv ʾeth-yədhēhem ʿal-rōʾsh håʾåyil
English: And thou shalt take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַטְתָּ֣ אֶת־הָאַ֗יִל וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ מִדָּמוֹ֙ וְנָֽתַתָּ֡ה עַל־תְּנוּךְ֩ אֹ֨זֶן אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְעַל־תְּנ֨וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן בָּנָיו֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְלָ֖ם הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְזָרַקְתָּ֧ אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃

English: Then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ מִן־הַדָּ֨ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּחַ֮ וּמִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֒ וְהִזֵּיתָ֤ עַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְעַל־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְעַל־בָּנָ֛יו וְעַל־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וְקָדַ֥שׁ הוּא֙ וּבְגָדָ֔יו וּבָנָ֛יו וּבִגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå min-haddåm ʾasher ʿal-hammizbēaḥ ūmisshemen hammishḥåh vəhizzēthå ʿal-ʾaharōn vəʿal-bəghådhåv vəʿal-bånåv vəʿal-bighdhē vånåv ʾittō vəqådhash hūʾ ūvəghådhåv ūvånåv ūvighdhē vånåv ʾittō
English: And thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be hallowed, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him.

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ מִן־הָ֠אַיִל הַחֵ֨לֶב וְהָֽאַלְיָ֜ה וְאֶת־הַחֵ֣לֶב הַֽמְכַסֶּ֣ה אֶת־הַקֶּ֗רֶב וְאֵ֨ת יֹתֶ֤רֶת הַכָּבֵד֙ וְאֵ֣ת שְׁתֵּ֣י הַכְּלָיֹ֗ת וְאֶת־הַחֵ֨לֶב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲלֵהֶ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֑ין כִּ֛י אֵ֥יל מִלֻּאִ֖ים הֽוּא׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå min-håʾayil haḥēlev vəhåʾalyåh vəʾeth-haḥēlev hamkhasseh ʾeth-haqqerev vəʾēth yōthereth hakkåvēdh vəʾēth shətē hakkəlåyōth vəʾeth-haḥēlev ʾasher ʿalēhen vəʾēth shōq hayyåmîn kî ʾēl milluʾîm hūʾ
English: Also thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder; for it is a ram of consecration:

Hebrew: וְכִכַּ֨ר לֶ֜חֶם אַחַ֗ת וַֽחַלַּ֨ת לֶ֥חֶם שֶׁ֛מֶן אַחַ֖ת וְרָקִ֣יק אֶחָ֑ד מִסַּל֙ הַמַּצּ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəkhikkar leḥem ʾaḥath vaḥallath leḥem shemen ʾaḥath vəråqîq ʾeḥådh missal hammatṣṣōth ʾasher lifnē ʾadhōnåi
English: And one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the LORD:

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ הַכֹּ֔ל עַ֚ל כַּפֵּ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְעַ֖ל כַּפֵּ֣י בָנָ֑יו וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəsamtå hakkōl ʿal kappē ʾaharōn vəʿal kappē vånåv vəhēnaftå ʾōthåm tənūfåh lifnē ʾadhōnåi
English: And thou shalt put all in the hands of Aaron, and in the hands of his sons; and shalt wave them for a wave offering before the LORD.

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ מִיָּדָ֔ם וְהִקְטַרְתָּ֥ הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חָה עַל־הָעֹלָ֑ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיח֨וֹחַ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה אִשֶּׁ֥ה ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå ʾōthåm miyyådhåm vəhiqṭartå hammizbēḥåh ʿal-håʿōlåh lərēaḥ nîḥōaḥ lifnē ʾadhōnåi ʾissheh hūʾ laʾdhōnåi
English: And thou shalt receive them of their hands, and burn them upon the altar for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour before the LORD: it is an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הֶֽחָזֶ֗ה מֵאֵ֤יל הַמִּלֻּאִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹת֛וֹ תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְמָנָֽה׃
Translit: vəlåqaḥtå ʾeth-heḥåzeh mēʾēl hammilluʾîm ʾasher ləʾaharōn vəhēnaftå ʾōthō tənūfåh lifnē ʾadhōnåi vəhåyåh ləkhå ləmånåh
English: And thou shalt take the breast of the ram of Aaron's consecration, and wave it for a wave offering before the LORD: and it shall be thy part.

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֞ אֵ֣ת חֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוּנַ֖ף וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר הוּרָ֑ם מֵאֵיל֙ הַמִּלֻּאִ֔ים מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר לְבָנָֽיו׃
Translit: vəqiddashtå ʾēth ḥazēh hattənūfåh vəʾēth shōq hattərūmåh ʾasher hūnaf vaʾasher hūråm mēʾēl hammilluʾîm mēʾasher ləʾaharōn ūmēʾasher ləvånåv
English: And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of the consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons:

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ לְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וּלְבָנָ֜יו לְחָק־עוֹלָ֗ם מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י תְרוּמָ֖ה ה֑וּא וּתְרוּמָ֞ה יִהְיֶ֨ה מֵאֵ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִזִּבְחֵ֣י שַׁלְמֵיהֶ֔ם תְּרוּמָתָ֖ם לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəhåyåh ləʾaharōn ūləvånåv ləḥåq-ʿōlåm mēʾēth bənē yisråʾēl kî thərūmåh hūʾ ūthərūmåh yihyeh mēʾēth bənē-yisråʾēl mizzivḥē shalmēhem tərūmåthåm laʾdhōnåi
English: And it shall be Aaron's and his sons' by a statute for ever from the children of Israel: for it is an heave offering: and it shall be an heave offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifice of their peace offerings, even their heave offering unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וּבִגְדֵ֤י הַקֹּ֨דֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן יִהְי֥וּ לְבָנָ֖יו אַחֲרָ֑יו לְמָשְׁחָ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם וּלְמַלֵּא־בָ֖ם אֶת־יָדָֽם׃
Translit: ūvighdhē haqqōdhesh ʾasher ləʾaharōn yihyū ləvånåv ʾaḥaråv ləmåshḥåh våhem ūləmallēʾ-våm ʾeth-yådhåm
English: And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons' after him, to be anointed therein, and to be consecrated in them.

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יִלְבָּשָׁ֧ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן תַּחְתָּ֖יו מִבָּנָ֑יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֛א אֶל־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד לְשָׁרֵ֥ת בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translit: shivʿath yåmîm yilbåshåm hakkōhēn taḥtåv mibbånåv ʾasher yåvōʾ ʾel-ʾōhel mōʿēdh ləshårēth baqqōdhesh
English: And that son that is priest in his stead shall put them on seven days, when he cometh into the tabernacle of the congregation to minister in the holy place.

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת אֵ֥יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֖ים תִּקָּ֑ח וּבִשַּׁלְתָּ֥ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בְּמָקֹ֥ם קָדֹֽשׁ׃
Translit: vəʾēth ʾēl hammilluʾîm tiqqåḥ ūvisshaltå ʾeth-bəsårō bəmåqōm qådhōsh
English: And thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.

Hebrew: וְאָכַ֨ל אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר הָאַ֔יִל וְאֶת־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסָּ֑ל פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translit: vəʾåkhal ʾaharōn ūvånåv ʾeth-bəsar håʾayil vəʾeth-halleḥem ʾasher bassål pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh
English: And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Hebrew: וְאָכְל֤וּ אֹתָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כֻּפַּ֣ר בָּהֶ֔ם לְמַלֵּ֥א אֶת־יָדָ֖ם לְקַדֵּ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑ם וְזָ֥ר לֹא־יֹאכַ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֵֽם׃
Translit: vəʾåkhlū ʾōthåm ʾasher kuppar båhem ləmallēʾ ʾeth-yådhåm ləqaddēsh ʾōthåm vəzår lōʾ-yōʾkhal kî-qōdhesh hēm
English: And they shall eat those things wherewith the atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat thereof, because they are holy.

Hebrew: וְֽאִם־יִוָּתֵ֞ר מִבְּשַׂ֧ר הַמִּלֻּאִ֛ים וּמִן־הַלֶּ֖חֶם עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר וְשָׂרַפְתָּ֤ אֶת־הַנּוֹתָר֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵ֖ל כִּי־קֹ֥דֶשׁ הֽוּא׃
Translit: vəʾim-yivvåthēr mibbəsar hammilluʾîm ūmin-halleḥem ʿadh-habbōqer vəsåraftå ʾeth-hannōthår båʾēsh lōʾ yēʾåkhēl kî-qōdhesh hūʾ
English: And if ought of the flesh of the consecrations, or of the bread, remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ לְאַהֲרֹ֤ן וּלְבָנָיו֙ כָּ֔כָה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּ֖יתִי אֹתָ֑כָה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תְּמַלֵּ֥א יָדָֽם׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå ləʾaharōn ūləvånåv kåkhåh kəkhōl ʾasher-tṣivvîthî ʾōthåkhåh shivʿath yåmîm təmallēʾ yådhåm
English: And thus shalt thou do unto Aaron, and to his sons, according to all things which I have commanded thee: seven days shalt thou consecrate them.

Hebrew: וּפַ֨ר חַטָּ֜את תַּעֲשֶׂ֤ה לַיּוֹם֙ עַל־הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים וְחִטֵּאתָ֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּכַפֶּרְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו וּמָֽשַׁחְתָּ֥ אֹת֖וֹ לְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃
Translit: ūfar ḥaṭṭåʾth taʿaseh layyōm ʿal-hakkippurîm vəḥiṭṭēʾthå ʿal-hammizbēaḥ bəkhapperkhå ʿålåv ūmåshaḥtå ʾōthō ləqaddəshō
English: And thou shalt offer every day a bullock for a sin offering for atonement: and thou shalt cleanse the altar, when thou hast made an atonement for it, and thou shalt anoint it, to sanctify it.
column7: and upon the net shalt thou make four brasen rings in the four corners thereof.

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים תְּכַפֵּר֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְקִדַּשְׁתָּ֖ אֹת֑וֹ וְהָיָ֤ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֨חַ֙ קֹ֣דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֔ים כָּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בַּמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יִקְדָּֽשׁ׃
Translit: shivʿath yåmîm təkhappēr ʿal-hammizbēaḥ vəqiddashtå ʾōthō vəhåyåh hammizbēaḥ qōdhesh qådhåshîm kål-hannōghēaʿ bammizbēaḥ yiqdåsh
English: Seven days thou shalt make an atonement for the altar, and sanctify it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatsoever toucheth the altar shall be holy.

Hebrew: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה שְׁנַ֥יִם לַיּ֖וֹם תָּמִֽיד׃
Translit: vəzeh ʾasher taʿaseh ʿal-hammizbēaḥ kəvåsîm bənē-shånåh shənayim layyōm tåmîdh
English: Now this is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar; two lambs of the first year day by day continually.

Hebrew: אֶת־הַכֶּ֥בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה בַבֹּ֑קֶר וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
Translit: ʾeth-hakkeves håʾeḥådh taʿaseh vabbōqer vəʾēth hakkeves hasshēnî taʿaseh bēn håʿarbåyim
English: The one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even:

Hebrew: וְעִשָּׂרֹ֨ן סֹ֜לֶת בָּל֨וּל בְּשֶׁ֤מֶן כָּתִית֙ רֶ֣בַע הַהִ֔ין וְנֵ֕סֶךְ רְבִעִ֥ית הַהִ֖ין יָ֑יִן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translit: vəʿissårōn sōleth bålūl bəshemen kåthîth revaʿ hahîn vənēsekh rəviʿîth hahîn yåyin lakkeves håʾeḥådh
English: And with the one lamb a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil; and the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering.

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֣ין הָעַרְבָּ֑יִם כְּמִנְחַ֨ת הַבֹּ֤קֶר וּכְנִסְכָּהּ֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֔הּ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəʾēth hakkeves hasshēnî taʿaseh bēn håʿarbåyim kəminḥath habbōqer ūkhəniskåhh taʿaseh-låhh lərēaḥ nîḥōaḥ ʾissheh laʾdhōnåi
English: And the other lamb thou shalt offer at even, and shalt do thereto according to the meat offering of the morning, and according to the drink offering thereof, for a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

Hebrew: עֹלַ֤ת תָּמִיד֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אִוָּעֵ֤ד לָכֶם֙ שָׁ֔מָּה לְדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁם׃
Translit: ʿōlath tåmîdh lədhōrōthēkhem pethaḥ ʾōhel-mōʿēdh lifnē ʾadhōnåi ʾasher ʾivvåʿēdh låkhem shåmmåh lədhabbēr ʾēlekhå shåm
English: This shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD: where I will meet you, to speak there unto thee.
column7: the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.

Hebrew: וְנֹעַדְתִּ֥י שָׁ֖מָּה לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנִקְדַּ֖שׁ בִּכְבֹדִֽי׃
Translit: vənōʿadhtî shåmmåh livnē yisråʾēl vəniqdash bikhvōdhî
English: And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and the tabernacle shall be sanctified by my glory.

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתִּ֛י אֶת־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֧ן וְאֶת־בָּנָ֛יו אֲקַדֵּ֖שׁ לְכַהֵ֥ן לִֽי׃
Translit: vəqiddashtî ʾeth-ʾōhel mōʿēdh vəʾeth-hammizbēaḥ vəʾeth-ʾaharōn vəʾeth-bånåv ʾaqaddēsh ləkhahēn lî
English: And I will sanctify the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar: I will sanctify also both Aaron and his sons, to minister to me in the priest's office.

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣כַנְתִּ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translit: vəshåkhantî bəthōkh bənē yisråʾēl vəhåyîthî låhem lēʾlōhîm
English: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֗וּ כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֧אתִי אֹתָ֛ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לְשָׁכְנִ֣י בְתוֹכָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translit: vəyådhʿū kî ʾanî ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhēhem ʾasher hōtṣēʾthî ʾōthåm mēʾeretṣ mitṣrayim ləshåkhnî vəthōkhåm ʾanî ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhēhem
English: And they shall know that I am the LORD their God, that brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them: I am the LORD their God.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ מִקְטַ֣ר קְטֹ֑רֶת עֲצֵ֥י שִׁטִּ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå mizbēaḥ miqṭar qəṭōreth ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm taʿaseh ʾōthō
English: And thou shalt make an altar to burn incense upon: of shittim wood shalt thou make it.

Hebrew: אַמָּ֨ה אָרְכּ֜וֹ וְאַמָּ֤ה רָחְבּוֹ֙ רָב֣וּעַ יִהְיֶ֔ה וְאַמָּתַ֖יִם קֹמָת֑וֹ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ קַרְנֹתָֽיו׃
Translit: ʾammåh ʾårkō vəʾammåh råḥbō råvūaʿ yihyeh vəʾammåthayim qōmåthō mimmennū qarnōthåv
English: A cubit shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof; foursquare shall it be: and two cubits shall be the height thereof: the horns thereof shall be of the same.

Hebrew: וְצִפִּיתָ֨ אֹת֜וֹ זָהָ֣ב טָה֗וֹר אֶת־גַּגּ֧וֹ וְאֶת־קִירֹתָ֛יו סָבִ֖יב וְאֶת־קַרְנֹתָ֑יו וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לּ֛וֹ זֵ֥ר זָהָ֖ב סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vətṣippîthå ʾōthō zåhåv ṭåhōr ʾeth-gaggō vəʾeth-qîrōthåv såvîv vəʾeth-qarnōthåv vəʿåsîthå lō zēr zåhåv såvîv
English: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns thereof; and thou shalt make unto it a crown of gold round about.

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי֩ טַבְּעֹ֨ת זָהָ֜ב תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ מִתַּ֣חַת לְזֵר֗וֹ עַ֚ל שְׁתֵּ֣י צַלְעֹתָ֔יו תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֣י צִדָּ֑יו וְהָיָה֙ לְבָתִּ֣ים לְבַדִּ֔ים לָשֵׂ֥את אֹת֖וֹ בָּהֵֽמָּה׃
Translit: ūshətē ṭabbəʿōth zåhåv taʿaseh-lō mittaḥath ləzērō ʿal shətē tṣalʿōthåv taʿaseh ʿal-shənē tṣiddåv vəhåyåh ləvåttîm ləvaddîm låsēʾth ʾōthō båhēmmåh
English: And two golden rings shalt thou make to it under the crown of it, by the two corners thereof, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make it; and they shall be for places for the staves to bear it withal.

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ אֶת־הַבַּדִּ֖ים עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֑ים וְצִפִּיתָ֥ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translit: vəʿåsîthå ʾeth-habbaddîm ʿatṣē shiṭṭîm vətṣippîthå ʾōthåm zåhåv
English: And thou shalt make the staves of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֑ת לִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־הָ֣עֵדֻ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לְךָ֖ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translit: vənåthattåh ʾōthō lifnē happårōkheth ʾasher ʿal-ʾarōn håʿēdhuth lifnē hakkappōreth ʾasher ʿal-håʿēdhuth ʾasher ʾivvåʿēdh ləkhå shåmmåh
English: And thou shalt put it before the vail that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with thee.

Hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֥יר עָלָ֛יו אַהֲרֹ֖ן קְטֹ֣רֶת סַמִּ֑ים בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֗קֶר בְּהֵיטִיב֛וֹ אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֖ת יַקְטִירֶֽנָּה׃
Translit: vəhiqṭîr ʿålåv ʾaharōn qəṭōreth sammîm babbōqer babbōqer bəhēṭîvō ʾeth-hannērōth yaqṭîrennåh
English: And Aaron shall burn thereon sweet incense every morning: when he dresseth the lamps, he shall burn incense upon it.

Hebrew: וּבְהַעֲלֹ֨ת אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֛ת בֵּ֥ין הָעֲרְבַּ֖יִם יַקְטִירֶ֑נָּה קְטֹ֧רֶת תָּמִ֛יד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: ūvəhaʿalōth ʾaharōn ʾeth-hannērōth bēn håʿarbayim yaqṭîrennåh qəṭōreth tåmîdh lifnē ʾadhōnåi lədhōrōthēkhem
English: And when Aaron lighteth the lamps at even, he shall burn incense upon it, a perpetual incense before the LORD throughout your generations.

Hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲל֥וּ עָלָ֛יו קְטֹ֥רֶת זָרָ֖ה וְעֹלָ֣ה וּמִנְחָ֑ה וְנֵ֕סֶךְ לֹ֥א תִסְּכ֖וּ עָלָֽיו׃
Translit: lōʾ-thaʿalū ʿålåv qəṭōreth zåråh vəʿōlåh ūminḥåh vənēsekh lōʾ thissəkhū ʿålåv
English: Ye shall offer no strange incense thereon, nor burnt sacrifice, nor meat offering; neither shall ye pour drink offering thereon.

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־קַרְנֹתָ֔יו אַחַ֖ת בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה מִדַּ֞ם חַטַּ֣את הַכִּפֻּרִ֗ים אַחַ֤ת בַּשָּׁנָה֙ יְכַפֵּ֤ר עָלָיו֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם קֹֽדֶשׁ־קָֽדָשִׁ֥ים ה֖וּא לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəkhipper ʾaharōn ʿal-qarnōthåv ʾaḥath basshånåh middam ḥaṭṭaʾth hakkippurîm ʾaḥath basshånåh yəkhappēr ʿålåv lədhōrōthēkhem qōdhesh-qådhåshîm hūʾ laʾdhōnåi
English: And Aaron shall make an atonement upon the horns of it once in a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonements: once in the year shall he make atonement upon it throughout your generations: it is most holy unto the LORD.
